definition: (old) itinerant political adviser/(fig.) lobbyist/go-between/mouthpiece/also pr. [shuo1 ke4]
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
customer/visitor/guest

sentences.english: Lobbyists use slush fund to bribe public officials.
sentences.chinese: 院外集團的說客用賄金拉攏政府官員。

sentences.english: The problem is the role that lobbyists have come to play.
sentences.chinese: 問題在於說客應該扮演一個什麼樣的角色。

sentences.english: Samples have been received by the State of Ohio.
sentences.chinese: 意思是說客戶已經收到你寄過去的樣品。

sentences.english: There already is a long line of lobbyists bidding for federal money.
sentences.chinese: 向聯邦政府伸手要錢的說客已經排成了一條長龍。
很明顯，他只是在說客氣話罷了。

sentences.english: Home of the little girl water lotus also served as lobbyists.
sentences.chinese: 駐地的小姑娘水蓮還主動當起了說客。

sentences.english: Corporations and trade associations are recruiting Democratic lobbyists.
sentences.chinese: 企業和同業工會正僱用民主黨說客。

sentences.english: Fakir is a fictitious world constructed with "fairy-tale".
sentences.chinese: 《癡愚說客》是用“童話”演繹的虛擬世界。

sentences.english: Some companies that have hired lobbyists are looking for research and development help.
sentences.chinese: 一些僱傭了說客的公司正在尋求研究開發方面的幫助。

sentences.english: But Wall Street’s lobbyists may well succeed in blunting the bill’s impact.
sentences.chinese: 但是華爾街的說客也能使這項法案失效。

sentences.english: Therefore, Hakka speakers can be found throughout the world.
sentences.chinese: 因此在世界各地都能找到說客家話的人。

sentences.english: All of Hank's friends tease him about being a tree hugger because of his great love of nature.
sentences.chinese: 漢克摯愛自然，所有的朋友都笑稱他爲環保說客。

sentences.english: It also rebuffed MPs' demands for a register of lobbyists.
sentences.chinese: 它還回絕了議員關於說客登記的要求。

definition: open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
talented field commander (military)
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
strictly impartial and incorruptible (idiom)
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: power struggle
to obstruct/to impede
to form a clique
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to be in charge of something specific
old school/conservative faction
to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
to seize power
to die in battle (idiom)
